page.title: 13HOUSING IN SHERIFF HUTTON
page.content: The majority of 18th and 19th C.houses at the East end have been modernised, often extended and well preserved.Two 17th C.houses have remains of cruck beams.Council houses,(severel now privatly owned and improved)and including Airey houses,flats and bungalows are at Western and Eastern limits.Modern developments are on the outskirts,with in-filling in large gardens.Sheriff Hutton is now a'key village'for development in Ryedale.80 new houses(kept within the confines of the village)are allowed in the present decade.Recently built houses of stone or brick,are predominantly detached. Housing in Lilling is almost unchanged since the 19th C. Outlying farms are mainly sturdy,19 C. of brick or stone.
